This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: tver.jp

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://tver.jp/episodes/epljcn4dd7](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftver.jp%2Fepisodes%2Fepljcn4dd7) ### Comment > The following error occurs in TVer and the video cannot be played. (TVer is a Japanese TV online distribution official site, and you may need to use a VPN to view it from outside Japan. This issue occurs within Japan.) > > Communication Error > A communication error has occurred. > Please refresh the screen or check again after some time. ### [NSFW] Screenshots

comment.body: It happens only if https filtering is not enabled since in that case `@@||imasdk.googleapis.com/js/sdkloader/ima3.js$domain=tver.jp` can not be applied. Make sure you have enabled https filtering, but if the issue persists, maybe it is not applied on tver for some unknown reason or bug. If so, I don't know what to do.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.2.168

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers, AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://perchance.org/ai-text-to-image-generator

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

AdGuard gets detected on the website and the page gets reloaded after 60 seconds when "OK" on the alert is clicked.

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/24798198/1380d69a-514f-48e7-96f8-a2c19a837be9)

</details>

I am currently using my own UserScript in Tampermonkey for bypassing the ads.

Here's the UserScript: https://greasyfork.org/en/scripts/476914-ads-perchance/code

I don't know if it's possible to create an AdGuard filter from this.




### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
These rules are also needed:
```
://www.*.css|$script,third-party
://www.*/images/*.min.js|$script,third-party
://www.*.com/css/$script,third-party,domain=~principal.com|~principalcdn.com
://www.*.com/js/css/$script,third-party
```
but you may want to add `domain=` for them too given [false positive](https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/20983).
